About Me

Hello! I'm Ujjwal Gulecha, a passionate Software Engineer currently working at DoorDash in the San Francisco Bay Area. I love building scalable systems, solving complex algorithmic problems, and exploring the fascinating world of machine learning.

Background

I hold a graduate degree from the University of California, San Diego, and completed my undergraduate studies at R.V. College of Engineering in Bangalore. My journey in technology has been driven by curiosity and a passion for creating innovative solutions to real-world problems.

Professional Experience

At DoorDash, I work on building systems that serve millions of users worldwide. My expertise lies in algorithm design, scalable system architecture, and machine learning applications. I have a patent filed for "System and method for logistical assistance with data exchange," reflecting my commitment to innovative problem-solving.

Achievements & Recognition

  • Multiple awards in ACM ICPC programming contests
  • Winner in IEEE XTREME programming competitions
  • Patent holder for logistical data exchange systems
  • Active member of ACM, IEEE, and IAENG

Notable Projects

Sign Language Recognition

Developed a neural network system using Recurrent Neural Networks to recognize and interpret sign language gestures.

Special Chat

Created an SMS application specifically designed for visually impaired users, improving accessibility in communication.

Distributed File System

Built a robust distributed file system focusing on scalability, fault tolerance, and efficient data management.

Certifications

  • Java Memory Management Certification
  • Complete Guide to ElasticSearch
  • CockroachDB Certification

Languages

I'm multilingual, speaking English, Hindi, and Marwadi natively, with elementary proficiency in Kannada. This linguistic diversity helps me connect with people from various backgrounds and cultures.
